author: Special Correspondent
text:
Former Puthiya Tamilagam Virudhunagar secretary, K. Ramaraj (57) and a party functionary, S. Marudhupandi (51), were arrested on Sunday in connection with a house trespass and criminal intimidation case.

The police said that Ramaraj, Marudhupandi along with Murugesan and his family members had broken open the lock of a house belonging to P. Krishnan on Ashok Talkies Road on Friday.

They were also accused of damaging the articles in the house, the Virudhunagar Superintendent of Police, P. Aravindhan, said in a statement.

Based on a complaint lodged by Krishnan, the Rajapalayam (South) police arrested them and remanded to judicial custody also under Tamil Nadu Public Property (Prevention of Damage and Loss) Act.

The police said that Krishnan’s mother, Pitchaimaniammal had retrieved the house pledged by her father, Ayyanar. Later, she made the name transfer of the property to her son Krishnan. Pitchaimaniammal’s brothers, Murugesan and Karunakaran, had been claiming that they too had share in the ancestral property and the civil dispute was pending before the court.

Meanwhile, on Friday, Murugesan had taken the help of Ramaraj and Marudhupandi of Sankarankoil to break open the house.

Murugesan and his family members were also booked in the case, the police said.
title: Puthiya Tamilagam ex-functionary held
